If players willingly play a game where it's very apparent that Autofill is a very active part of our queue system, they should be willing to at least bother to try, or at the very least, try to not be a problem for the team. Blatant ignorance doesn't work if it's staring you dead on.

What if you're a better player / better scaling champion than the ADC and it is clear that putting gold onto the ADC is a waste?  I've definitely encountered this before where playing support bot lane that I was the far superior carry to the adc.  Isn't it just ignorance then to waste gold putting it onto a sub optimal carry choice?

I will play the carry supports a lot (because it's hella fun), and will avoid as much as possible to not take CS (thank you dumb Voidlings on Malzahar).  There are a lot of games where I'm just better at carrying a game than the ADC.

Then queue for the role of ADC. As a low elo player, I'm very familiar with the onslaught of problems it comes with. Trolls, toxic players, players with an overbearing sense of superiority, no communication, etc. All of which feels more potent of an issue than someone who simply isn't good at the game. It's hard, I know, knowing that regardless of what we do, both the faults of our own, and as a group, can still invoke a loss. But the moment we throw away the potential growth for teamwork for the sake of improving only ourselves with the sacrifice of an ally, it will very much turn a bad situation into something worse.

This game isn't in season 2 anymore. We don't have the flexibility to simply forego our own growth and ignore the growth of our team. The game as it is right now, is designed to punish those who have ignored all sense of communication and team growth up unto even the introduction of Season 6.

I'm awful at ADC though.  I'm garbage at CSing while trading effectively.  They are skills I need to learn to be sure.  I've definitely picked support and got into a game with an autofilled ADC that doesn't know what he's doing (says so).  In these instances, I'll pick Brand (he's just so damn gold efficient and his team fighting presence is insane).  How am I supposed to 'assign myself as ADC'?  I don't know since I can ask, but I'll probably be just as bad, and it just doesn't seem like a good move until I suck less at ADC (probably suck less being a laner instead of support I guess).  As for the growth, I assume you mean Gold advantage or Gold in general.  Whenever I am on my game as the APC Supports, my ADC usually just overtakes the opponent ADC in CS since I'm providing him a lane where he can just focus CS while I chunk out and put the enemy laners on the back foot.  It usually seems like a great choice to still play the APC Supports.

Usually getting us a could kills and assists in the mean time.  All the while I'll usually have wards up to help track the enemy jungler and keep us safe by knowing his location.  This pressure bot lane by being the APC (and not ADC) draws the attention of the jungler away from the other lanes (letting them feel safer as well), and as long as we don't fuck up and get killed (it happens).  How is that not team play for growth?

As for communication, I don't really rely on it a ton actually because it is just too risky to inspire flame / trolling.  I try to synergize with the team as best as I can with just minimal pings (still communication I guess), and following their map movements.  I'll use pings when I want / feel it is safe/good to take an objective like Dragon / Baron.

Sorry, I'd realize the redundancy in my original choice of words, and had edited it to my intended wording. Working with no energy after getting home from work fried my sense of logical thinking.

Additionally, my mention of growth actually refers to the player, not the champion. Gold gain means jack if the player itself can't hit his/her target at the appropriate time. I apologize for the self reference yet again, but the bronze tiers as a whole are a perfect representation of what I'm talking about. Players who are here due to either trolls/toxic players, or just as much due to the lack of sense of team effort or otherwise. I can't tell you how many times I've watched a lane die despite my pings or contextual clues that a fizz or some other monstrosity is about to rid them of their virtual innocence with the gang bang that's about to take place if they don't move. They ignore it of course, and die. Not once have I ever seen someone response appropriately to blatant warnings, because they choose to ignore team communication, because they choose to isolate themselves if it's not for the convenience of wanting someone to blame if something happens.

People can do well with their roles, they can fulfill it to best of their abilities. But if something is lacking, it'll show. I commonly play mid, sometimes ad, sometimes top, sometimes support, and I've been fed before. I've had my lane snowballed, and I've won my lane. But the moment roaming phase hits, it's a common theme to witness that go all out the window for this or that reason. Moment a lane loses, my power is just as greatly imposed by the power of that lane, so and so forth. 

Inexperienced players happen to appear in games, whether we like it or not. But regardless if we win or lose, if we intentionally ruin their chance to learn, we aren't helping the problem, we're making it worse. They lose that chance to learn, that chance to get better. Losses come with the territory, but it will always come down to why we lost.

I don't play Sion Support actually.  I've thought about picking it up because I've seen the terror it can bring.

As for a better scaler, it's always a tough call since it's hard to know who scales better being a Silver level player.  I could be wrong, but I've always seen some ADCs as more garbage late game (Lucian) and good mid/early.  I usually play Zyra/Malzahar/Brand to carry (though Malzahar is probably a pick AP Support instead of a APC Support) which I view as scaling better than Lucian because Lucian's main problem is he's screwed over by Ninja Tabis and his short range is a huge hinderance (while Zyra/Brand don't have that issue) for example.

I never say I take the gold.  I even mentioned that I actively avoid CS during laning phase (it changes during team fights and late game because lane cleanup isn't a priority for Silvers as much and I'll save a tower from a huge wave which usually inflates my end game CS).  I'll typically have maybe taken 2 CS during the entire laning phase (even as Malzahar), so I'm not sure where you are getting your assumptions from because it's certainly not reading what I'm typing.  As for kill gold, a lot of the times my laner gets it, while a minor amount of the time I get it (talking about laning phase specifically).  While if I had picked supports that I'm assuming you want me to pick, there would be no kill gold.  It's still a net +150/200 or 300/400 regardless of whether or not my ADC got the kill.  The enemies still died because of my play/support choice and my ADC still got extra gold.

As for being mad at a weak adc, you have no idea my personal outlook and couldn't be entirely more wrong about where I place blame. I focus on myself, and if someone else is not doing well, I could care less.  It's understandable that you think that way since it is fairly common in LoL.  I'm not surprised, but like I said you're entirely wrong there.

Well if you read it, it's a hypothetical question.

I was asking the opinion of the poster when the ADC is a poor player, and giving them gold is a waste.  Let's say they have 0 CS (they are just missing everything, and not being harassed let's say).  it was an inquiry, not a statement.  There is a reason that asking a question is not necessarily the same as saying something.

"What if I have herpes?" is different than "I have herpes.!!!!" just on a logical level.  It is suggestive, but doesn't always mean that I have herpes.  Hence why I didn't tell you that I 'do not waste gold on the adc'.  Because I usually do, despite when I can tell the ADC is a sub optimal choice for gold income.  Thankfully, Support Carries are gold efficient, so it's not terribly bad choice to still do that.

Especially with a following statement (about CS) indicating that I avoid stealing gold in some situations, it's logically consistent to assume that would probably extend to other areas as well.

I also called you entirely wrong about your _assumption on my outlook_ and not my taking gold from kills, and you're still wrong there because there is nothing in any of my comments here indicating I'm a salty player.  Therefore, I'll still call you wrong in your assumptions about me.  You can take the Carry Wheel without being mad about it.

There are certainly times when the ADC can not get the kill.  

1) His positioning at the start is poor, and the enemies flash away so my ADC can't reach but I can
2) My ADC can't dodge anything and almost dies and has to flash away (then again not being in reach), but I can finish off the opponents
3) I solo kill someone because I can and no one is around.

However just like CS, I feed my ADC as much as possible, so like I said.  I never said "I always take the kills yo!".   I just asked the opinion of the person when putting gold into a carry where the person just needs to be carried, not given gold to see if they can maybe carry.  If it is obvious the ADC is new to the role, and won't be able to do it (they clearly can't position well, constantly die, can't cs, doesn't really know how to ADC in general) if possible, I will be far less cautious to avoid taking kills.  I'll just make sure the kill happens, and if the ADC gets it, fine, otherwise I don't mind the gold.  This is different than just always taking the gold.  ADC is really hard actually, so I don't blame when an ADC can't carry very well.
